subject: Technology
title: The Like Button Effect
description: A fast breakdown of The Like Button Effect for builders.

hook.text: In 2009, Facebook added a small thumbs-up icon. It seemed trivial. It changed human behavior.

buildup.text: Before the Like button, you had to write a comment to respond. Most people didn't bother.

discovery.text: The Like button made feedback effortless. Engagement on Facebook tripled almost overnight.

twist.text: Researchers found that Likes trigger dopamine, the same chemical released by gambling and sugar.

climax.text: Every major platform copied the model. Hearts, upvotes, and reactions now drive most social media.

punchline.text: One tiny button turned approval into an addiction.

quiz.question: What effect did the Like button have on Facebook?
